intro: Isgarum, commonly known as the common isgarum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are finely divided, giving it a feathery appearance. Isgarum is often found in meadows and along woodland edges, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
